website_summaries.verdict: A flour sifter just like Grandma's that is both beautiful and practical.
pros: Made from quality stainless steel to prevent rusting
Includes measurements on the side for 1 cup, 2 cups, and 3 cups
cons: Sifter does not have a lid to ensure the flour does not shoot out the top

customer_reviews.title: Pops flour or confectioners sugar out of sifter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my sifter in late August, but didn't open and use it until early October. I was excited to try, unfortunately I was very disappointed the mess the sifter made all over the surface I was using. It can sift well, but the problem is when you are sifting and rotating/cranking the handle it gets stuck and once it turns pass where it is stuck, it pops and your flour or confectioners sugar pops out and sprays your surface causing a mess. I should have tested it out to make sure it worked, but now it is to late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Viramontes

customer_reviews.title: Simple design that works well
customer_reviews.text: Made baking powder biscuits yesterday and used this. It was the first time ever for using a flour sifter and it worked wonderfully. It's amazing I hadn't used one of these before! At first I was wondering if the bail would not work its way through the very last bits of flour and would leave a bunch unsifted. Nope. It worked very effectively getting all but a very small number of grains through the screen. Then, a quick tap on the side cleaned it up. A nice, simple design. The one my mother had years ago was spring-powered where you squeezed the handle to move the bail. This is a much simpler, more effective design.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job sifting the flour.. however every time I turn the handle it shoots flour out the top making a mess. I have to hold a towel on the top of it to keep it from going everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Brittm03

customer_reviews.title: Just like Grandma's!
customer_reviews.text: Just like my old one! It's perfect and works great. I had my old one over 25 years. This time I will not wash but dust off if possible. Very happy with the design and quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered based on reviews and because I needed a sifter that was not the one handed type because of arthritis in my hands. I used for almond flour and sugar to make cookies. Sifter has handle for turning and two round metal strips that go over the mesh bottom screen. One rubs too hard on bottom and actually throws flour and sugar out the top. Not smooth at all. Defective or very poor design. I shook and used a spoon to get sifting done. Cookies were great but i can not use this sifter. I have ordered from Amazon for years and been pleased. This is the first time for a very disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Southern lady

customer_reviews.title: It’s a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: I used my new sifter for the first time when I made mini donuts. It works very, very well....it’s works smoothly. It’s just like the one I had many years ago. I was hoping that it would be and I wasn’t disappointed. I ordered two sitters because my son is gluten free and I just wanted to make sure it was free from any wheat flour when I baked for him. I didn’t want to wash the sifter even though I think I can. I have to admit that my old one did rust over time and I didn’t want my new one to end up the same way.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great Sifter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as it reminded me of the one my Grandma used. I love it! Well made and does what it should. I hand wash it and, so far, no rust issues or problems. I will add that my sister has another brand of sifter and she liked this one equally as well; however, I paid less for mine. Excellent product for the money. I think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Working Mom

customer_reviews.title: Seller rocks! Product good, too;)
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, great price. I really appreciate the seller reaching out to me via email with tips on usage. I never would have thought to not wash it but now I understand that doing so could produce a gluey flour/water mess. I'd purchase from this seller again happily!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good material but a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Good stainless materials, right size. The "mixing" hoop that you crank is a little flimsy, making it jam at times and harder to sift quickly. I bonded the end of the hoop to the crank handle using epoxy and dental floss. This made the hoop more rigid and allowed sifting twice as fast. It now feels like the 25 year old sifter it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I'm a bit disappointed by how much flour this product kicks back out ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed by how much flour this product kicks back out at you. I bought this to make macaroons and it worked, but the sifter was much fussier than I would have preferred. I would have bought one that processed twice the volume I wanted to sift if I knew how this product would behave. That said it did work, but you have to work a cup at a time. Okay I won't buy a replacement product, but I probably would not buy this product (at least this size) again.
customer_reviews.author: Christina R. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Sifter--Dishwasher Safe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sifter as a gift for my daughter and she loves it! It was delivered in a timely manner, well-packed, and arrived in perfect shape. The sifter is so smooth and the crank-style is easy to use. Suggestions for cleaning the sifter stated it could be put in the dishwasher (a big selling point for my daughter), hand washed, or just wiped clean. I don't see how it could be wiped clean and be clean enough to put back into a cupboard without having some residue still clinging to it--but the dishwasher method worked just fine! Will definitely order from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: B. Molden

customer_reviews.title: sharp edges inside
customer_reviews.text: I was cleaning this by hand as I think it wouldn't hold up in the dishwasher and the inside ledge near the sieve is so razor sharp that it sliced my finger pretty badly. I have to admit I don't want to use it because I know I will have to hand wash it and I am nervous about slicing my fingers again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: really hard to use
customer_reviews.text: just get a small "strainer". the kind that you tap on side. that works so much better and it was cheaper
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Extrremely well built.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of these on line and in stores. The one's in local stores are junk, mostly plastic. My mother and my wife's mother were young women in the late 40's and I remember that both these women made the best cakes and pies from scratch. We also noted that they sifted their flour before cooking in an exact sifter design device but it was War time and they eventually wore out. This sifter will not wear out. It is quality made.
customer_reviews.author: JMikeC - DFW

customer_reviews.title: It works very well
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with a double screen sifter that held less and was impossible to clean, I tossed it out and ordered this flour sifter through Amazon. Some may think it too old school with it's hand crank and single screen but this back-to-basics kitchen tool is easy to clean and to use. It made it through my Fall baking frenzy and I am more than pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my "trigger" sifter!
customer_reviews.text: I had an automatic sifter for the last 2 years, and even though I am not arthritic, that sifter was such a pain! I have used this one once, and I am already impressed. I had no problems using this sifter. I read other reviews that said it was launching flour out the top when the handle was cranked, but I moved steadily & slowly, and had no such problem. Possibly the wires or the mesh were misaligned in those reviews, but mine came in and worked beautifully. Additionally, because it's single layer wire mesh, it's much easier to clean! I'll never go back to an automatic sifter, and this product will make baking so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Flour sifter that works with fine flours.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this Bellemain flour sifter. I have been having trouble finding a sifter that works with powdered sugar and doesn't get clogged. I'm so pleased that this one does a great job and that it holds so much more than my other sifters. I would recommend this to any baker who likes to use different types of flour that might be too fine for other sifters.
customer_reviews.author: Mel's Notes

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I used with my grandmother
customer_reviews.text: This is an almost perfect recreation of the sifter I used with my grandmother 50- years ago to make biscuits. I finally decided to ditch the inferior one I've been using for over 20 years, and take a chance on this one. It's solid, sifts everything you put in it completely and evenly, and is as easy to clean as you could hope for from a sifter like this (none are perfect.) I'd buy this again in a heartbeat (if I ever have to).
customer_reviews.author: Floyd B.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising, it's not stainless steel!
customer_reviews.text: Says its stainless construction but put a magnet to it and you'll see it's common steel. There is only one part that is stainless steel the wire screen the rest will rust. False advertising again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Rusty
customer_reviews.text: I wish the screened basket was removable. It rusted the very first time I used it, and it was only in the dish water for about an hour, as I finished making a cake. Looked in the dishwater and was surprised to see rust forming around the holes of the screen. Attempted to remove the screen and it was only an attempt, it would not come out. I suppose I could permanently damage the sifter to get it out but then, it would defeat its purpose. I had to spend more time then I wanted to clean this sifters after use. A better and more thoughtful engineered sifter would be a better buy, even if it cost more.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: An ergonomic flour sifter?  Definitely!
customer_reviews.text: I used the sifter for the first time the other day to sift flour before making a pie crust. I like the hand crank style because it was easy to use even though I have arthritis as well as nerve damage in my hands. What a blessing. I followed the instructions and wiped it clean with a dry paper towel. Perfect. I would recommend it to anyone with problems with their hands. It is not advertised as ergonomic, but it is the next best thing to it.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce R.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS PRETTY DARN FLIMSY COMPARED TO THE STURDY ONE i GREW UP WITH. NOT THRILLED ABOUT THIS PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Djglr

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fast, and cleans well, too
customer_reviews.text: When my old sifter finally broke it's spring, I searched for a new one, and find this style of sifter is faster and more efficient (it sifts everything in the container) than the other kind (whatever it is known as). Also much easier on the hands. I have cleaned it at times when I've used an ingredient like cocoa that leaves a residue, and it cleans easily. I don't have a dishwasher so this is reported as cleaning by hand. I let the sifter thoroughly air dry before I store it. Overall I'm very pleased and expect this to last, well, forever :)
customer_reviews.author: Chava

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I just received my sifter and have used it twice. Not sure how I’ve baked without it all this time. I didn’t rate durability because I have just started using it, but I’m pretty sure it is going to prove to be very durable. I was going to buy another brand, but read the reviews and glad I did. If you are new to baking or well seasoned, as I am, I don’t think you could go wrong with this sifter.
customer_reviews.author: mary glanton

customer_reviews.title: Very, very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Not worth 12 cents, much less 12 dollars. Materials used in construction of this toy are very thin and weak. Mine arrived in non-working condition. Turning the little hand cranks does nothing - the wire won't go past the screen at the bottom. It would have never lasted beyond a couple of uses anyway, judging from the poor quality. So it's just a tin can with an open bottom and top, and a useless hand crank on the side. I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had a softer of this type years ago when I was newly married, and much prefer it to using a sieve that has to be shaken to sift flour, and makes a huge mess. It, however was made of much cheaper metal and over time rusted. I went looking on Amazon after getting frustrated on've again at the mess I had to clean up after baking a cake, and saw this one that was made with stainless steel. Used it today, and I love it. The sifting mechanism works very smoothly, and it does a great job. Best of all...no mess! Plus, the steel won't rust should I decide it needs to be washed.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Bridges Kelley

customer_reviews.title: This baker loves this sifter
customer_reviews.text: As a home baker who bakes at least one batch (often more) of cookies each week to share with family, my choir friends and colleagues, I needed a new sifter. This one is working very nicely. One real plus is the handle that turns rather than a squeeze handle. With an arthritic thumb a squeeze handle is painful to use - this sifter is easy to use and it sifts thoroughly. I do not recommend washing a sifter because flour or confectioner's sugar can gum it up. Shake this sifter over the sink to clean it and store in a plastic bag that seals.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this for baking purposes such as sifting flour or powdered sugar even though flour says sifted it may still have lumps. This sifter is sturdy and easy to use. It reminds me of the one that my Mother used when I was a child. Since it is stainless steel, it shouldn't rust as some of the cheaper ones do. I usually just hand rinse with water and dry and do not put it in the dishwasher. It is very easy to clean. So far, the screen has not warped which would make it hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: shoecrazy

customer_reviews.title: The sifter I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: It seems odd that it's hard to find a good sifter, but boy is it! I have arthritis in my fingers, and too many sifters require exhausting repetitive movements or dexterity that I don't have. This sifter is the bomb! It's fast, easy to use, easy on the hands and fingers, and it gets the job done. My only issue is that if you fill it too full, whatever you're sifting will fly everywhere (a lid would've helped). But this is an insignificant detail. Just don't overfill it! It's easy to clean, and plenty sturdy. I love this sifter and am so glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Marita Gronnvoll

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know how I lived without this
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and highly recommend it I don’t know how I lived without it. I’ve been making French Macarons and this has been making my life so much easier. It sifts the almond flour so quick and easy. They recommend not washing with water, so it just wipes clean easily. Also it holds a few cups at a time, so the size is great.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Great Sifter
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good sifter for my gluten free flours and hadn't used one in many years. Anything made in the USA gets my attention and I'm happy to say I'm not disappointed. This works well, sifting flours, powdered sugar, etc for my baking needs. Made with great quality stainless steel that will last a very long time. I definitely would encourage others to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Stainless Sifter
customer_reviews.text: Love this sifter! Flour and sugar seem to go effortlessly through the sifting grid ... using the crank almost seems unnecessary (but you do have to use it). Throws a bit of flour or cocoa through the hole on the side of the sifter where the crank attaches to the sifting grid, but it's not a big deal. Like any sifter, you need to crank more slowly with lighter items -- cocoa and some flours. I like the fact that the sifter has a stainless body and stainless sifting grid so they don't rust.
customer_reviews.author: mmctec

customer_reviews.title: Great Sifter
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this sifter. I had one that you had to squeeze the handle to sift the flour. After awhile using that one my hand felt like it was ready to fall off. I used this sifter for the first time this morning and it's wonderful. It sifted the flour so fast and easy. This is a great sifter and I couldn't be happier with it. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: topaz

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use sifter.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I went so many years without a flour sifter. I love to bake, but I kept putting off getting a sifter. This sifter is well made of rustproof stainless steel. It has capacity to hold 3 cups of flour, and it sifts the flour very quickly. I was torn between getting this 3 cup sifter, and getting a larger 5 cup sifter. The 3 cup ended up being the perfect size. It holds a good amount af flour without being unwieldy. I keep a 5 gallon bucket of flour in the pantry, and I just leave the sifter in the bucket when it’s not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Bequette

customer_reviews.title: Received the product in poor condition. The shipping package was fine but the ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the product in poor condition. The shipping package was fine but the sifter was bent and would not function. It seems cheaply made but for $10.00 I guess you can't expect much. The metal is thin and the wire inside was out of shape. Thanks to Amazon's great return policy I sent it back and got a refund and ordered a better item.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: High quality & American made!
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality sifter, and very similar to one my mother used for over 50 years. When she passed, my oldest sister got it and I had a cheap squeeze-handle sifter. Thankfully when browsing Amazon, I came across this little baby. I'm sure it will last for generation's like the one my mother had. Buy it, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: PMW

customer_reviews.title: Sifter anyone?
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know if I’m going to yse this now... my item is s simple item it’s just bent not completely 360 circle.
customer_reviews.author: Bambam

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you hand-wash and leave in a well-ventilated area to dry. Great quality, very sturdy and smooth, effortless crank.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Best Sifter Ever
customer_reviews.text: This sifter is wonderful! My old sifter was the kind where you squeeze the handle, over and over. I have rheumatoid arthritis and it became too painful. Also, flour got stuck between the screens and was terrible to clean. I am sooooo happy with my new one, it is larger and easy to use. Love the company that made this sifter - quality +
customer_reviews.author: Polly Heaton

customer_reviews.title: Great siever for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this sieve. It's easy to use, and for the money it will be a great addition to your kitchen. It is indeed made out of stainless, and I've only had to wash it once or twice. I run my flour or whatever through it, and put it back on the shelf until next time. I would encourage everyone who enjoys baking past the beginners level to purchase both a sieve and a scale to notch your recipes up a notch or two.
customer_reviews.author: Anime Lover Florida

customer_reviews.title: Ultmate Sifter
customer_reviews.text: This is an awsome sifter. No way to tell you how great it moves the flour through the process. For future innovations with this sifter, I'd like to see a silicone attachment that will grip the bottom and funnel the sifted flour into a measuring cup. That's it! Great, simple and will be much better than your rusting Wal-Mart one that comes out of the dishwasher......... Be careful, because it's awesome. You'll get a bunch with half a crank!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: spookycat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate!!!!!  IT’s great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had to sift 10 cups of flour. I used a 13 dry cup to add the flour to the Sifter. It went so quickly and mess free. Only suggestion I would have is after adding the flour, gently turn the handle and then proceed with speed. Because I got carried away once with the handle and kind of jerk jumped started it; (little dust bomb) 😊ooops. Other than that it is a pure pleasure to use!!!! Sincerely Tessakay
customer_reviews.author: Tessakay

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased with the ease of it
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted to buy one and finally did this year for Christmas! I am so pleased with the ease of it! I used to use something else in the past and it used to take forever, which would take all the fun out of what I wanted to bake. But now after using the sifter, it keeps the fun in my cooking and baking. So glad I finally bought one! Great product, easy, sturdy and came with comfort from the company to help out in any way they can. That always makes me feel good knowing they completely back their product!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Denhalter

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Size For Me
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at sifters for a few months trying to find one just the right size for smaller baking projects. I have a large one that is very nice but I never have need to sift 5 cups of flour. I found this Bellemain 3 cup sifter and it looked perfect for me. It arrived on time and in perfect condition. It is strong and works beautifully. I don't put it in water to clean it. I just shake out or wipe out the flour that is left behind. That way I am not risking any rust on the mesh. I love this little sifter. It is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetshrub

customer_reviews.title: Memories
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this sifter after reading the reviews. I've used it once so I can't speak to it's durability. I promptly received it and was excited to use it. It reminds me of my childhood and watching my grandmother use one like it. I've tried the modern day sifters and wasn't pleased at all. This one I like. Just using it made me feel like a baker, like my grandmother. I'm very happy I purchased this sifter. I would recommend it to anyone needing a sifter.
customer_reviews.author: C. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Rusted quickly
customer_reviews.text: I got it a year ago, it rusted almost immediately after a few washes. The quality was the same as the one I saw in the local grocery store for $7. I have a stainless steel grinder and a stainless steel strainer for years, they go to the dishwasher regularly and nothing happens to them. If I knew it's a low quality product I'd at least try being careful when washing/drying it.
customer_reviews.author: DreaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: We tossed our ancient rusted sifter a couple of years ago and did without. This year we wanted to have one that would not rust, so when we found this I ordered it. Came in a nicely oversized and well packed box, and it is gorgeous! Can't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R.

customer_reviews.title: It is very serviceable, and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: The good thing I saw about this sifter over my old one was the speed that I could sift. My old one simply agitated back and forth, and was very slow. The wire rotating type is much faster. The material may be stainless steel, but it is a very light grade and not nearly as well made as my old made in USA one. It is much easier to keep clean because it has only one screen and doesn’t collect flour like my old one, which has a double screen.
customer_reviews.author: EcoTico

customer_reviews.title: Good olde sifter
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we were looking for: a flour sifter that does what it should. As many other baking technologies improve, for some reason people have tried to improve the sifter. This goes back to what I grew up with: an all metal sifter with a turn crank. It works, it's easy to clean, and since it's made of metal instead of plastic, ingredients don't stick due to static cling.
customer_reviews.author: gtownrunner

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: There has to be a flour sifter made in the USA or France, Germany or Italy that is high quality and lasting. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: 3 Stars 'cause we haven't even used it and you are emailing us again
customer_reviews.text: We don't sift flour or anything every day of the week. This replaced an old, cruddy squeeze-handle model. It APPEARS to be a fine product and when we finally use it we will update this review. Amazon sellers are too quick with these rate-me, rate-this emails and we are about to halt them. Give us time to use the product. BTW, the old cruddy one was made in USA vs this from China. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: count_zero

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, as far as I could tell
customer_reviews.text: I used the product to make my first bread. Worked great , as far as I could tell. :-) Would recommend this to others. delievery was fast and item arrived in good condition. Light weight. I'm not sure if that's good or bad bc this my first time ever needing one. I'd be happy to buy from this vendor in the future.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Cleaner and faster
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any serious baker. I got so tired of sifting with a hand held strainer, getting flour everywhere, every time I shook it. Not to mention how time consuming it was and causing pain in my shoulder problem. I can recommend this sifter to all bakers, as it will make your baking more of a pleasure and not such a chore.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Old Fashioned Goodie | Modern Materials
customer_reviews.text: Well built, simple sifter. I don't think the volume markings on the can are accurate. I'll continue to use this but will pre-measure the flour or sugar when specific quantities are desired, otherwise whirl away. The vendor provided subsequent information regarding care and maintenance that confirms my standard practice = no or very infrequent washing. Glue city if you try it!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the units that had the sifter control on the handle. It never did feel right. This is a definite improvement. Some reviews comment on flour going out the side at the spinner hole and I can see how that would be an issue. But I rarely if ever use that much flour so it will not be a problem for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great action and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and fast. Great product. The only down-side to this product was I didn't see any notice in the packaging stating not to wash it after using (I didn't) but then I got an email a day after I received the product reminding me not to wash it after using it with flour. That doesn't make the product any worse I just thought that email or notice might be better served to come with or before the product arrived. I love the sifter and it was just so much easier to use than the ones my Mom and Grandma had when I was a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for the purpose but a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the price. Next time, however, I will spend the extra $ for a 4-wire sifter (this one is 2-wire) and a sturdier body. As for easy to clean, if you use it correctly, all you have to do is tap it a few times to get the last of the flout out. If you clean them with water, they will rust.
customer_reviews.author: William MacLeod

customer_reviews.title: this sifter works great and the stainless feature is a step up from ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a replacement for an older one. this sifter works great and the stainless feature is a step up from the older one that was not stainless.the scraper touches the bottom of the sifter and sifts very well. I plan to get one for my daughter soon. I do recommend this sifter.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Best Sifter Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of different sifters in my life and my new Bellemain Stainless Steel is by far my favorite. I'm over the top happy with the 3-cup size and the crank-style sifting feature works great without tiring out my hand. I've used it for several different types of flour, powdered sugar and powdered cacao. I rinse it well and let it air dry. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cathi Crismon

customer_reviews.title: the wires inside do make contact with the screen.
customer_reviews.text: Just the facts. I haven't used it yet but have played with it. It's sturdy stainless steel. I like that the wires make contact with the screen so I know it will do a good job. I like I can put it over a wide mouth funnel and sift right into a measuring cup. I do not remember what my mother and grandmother had....and I don't think you really care about what happened to the one I USED to have. Those 'details' shouldn't effect your decision whether to buy or not to buy this product. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Whoa!  What a difference. Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used the sifter for the first time today and I could not believe how easy it was to use compared to my older squeeze handle kind. I'm a Senior and have some arthritis in my hands and the other sifter was very difficult to use, as well as more time consuming. This crank handle sifter did 2 1/4 cups of flour in seconds. Truly impressed and my hands thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like Mom's

product_meta.title: Bellemain Stainless Steel 3 Cup Flour Sifter
feature_bullets: STRONG AND LIGHTWEIGHT SIFTER HOLDS A FULL 3 CUPS: Home baking just got easier. This sifter holds more flour or powdered sugar than most sifters made for home use. Measurements are stamped right into the metal and can easily be read from inside the sifter as well as outside.

CLASSIC RELIABLE HAND CRANK AND SINGLE MESH: Professionals prefer crank-style sifters over hand squeeze sifter models because they can stand up to repeated use without tiring out your hand. Sifting is effortless and clean up is super simple - no multi-layers of mesh for ingredients to get stuck.

THE DOUBLE LOOP AGITATOR LEAVES NOTHING BEHIND: Lumps of flour and sugar can get left behind to clog the mesh screens when using squeeze handle models, but the Bellemain Flour Sifter cranks smoothly, capturing everything. Works great with fine and coarse flours like almond meal and oat bran.

EASY FOR BAKERS WITH ARTHRITIS TO USE: Squeeze handles are hard to work and require hand strength - which means they can wear you out quickly. But the Bellemain Sifter’s hand crank operates smoothly and effortlessly - lightweight flours and sugars practically sift themselves.

RUST RESISTANT STAINLESS STEEL WILL EASILY LAST A GENERATION OR MORE: Stainless steel is lightweight, but stronger than aluminum or plastic - so you never need to worry about cracks, chips, dents and scratches. This is the sifter that you'll still be using in 20 years
